{"id":1471364292,"question_id":3219,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"2Â months","timestamp":1733435450,"status":11,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/1471364292/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Make Lexicographically Smallest Array by Swapping Elements","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    vector<int> lexicographicallySmallestArray(vector<int>& nums, int limit) {\n        int n = nums.size();\n        for(int i=0; i<n-1; i++) {\n            for(int j=i+1; j<n; j++)\n            if( nums[j] < nums[i] && abs(nums[i]-nums[j])<=limit ) {\n                swap(nums[i], nums[j]);\n            };\n        }\n        return nums;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"make-lexicographically-smallest-array-by-swapping-elements","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
